lines.text: Don't ever change, Tiger. I don't think I'd like you with a heart.
What is it, Jane? I just don't understand you! I've tried to give you everything you wanted, everything I could.
Yes, you've given me a dozen down payments and installments for the rest of our lives.
Looking for something?
My lipstick.
Colt or Smith and Wesson?
Did you notice where the liquor was when you went through my kitchen?
Sure!
Go make us a drink.
Stallin' honey?
What do I call you besides 'Stupid?'

[Chuckles]
Stupid'll do if you don't bruise easily. Otherwise you might try Danny.
This money's like poison, it's changing you, it's changing me.
I wish it were that easy, I've always been this way.
It's cold in here.
I'll turn on the oven.
[Steps over to the kitchenette, noise of oven lighting]
Maybe I shouldn't bother to light it, huh Tiger?
You know, tiger, I didn't know they made 'em as beautiful as you are, and as smart. Or as hard.
You haven't anything to hide, have you?
[Jane sits down and crosses her legs]
No, I can see you haven't.
Stop it, Jane! If we don't report this, it's a felony. It's the same as stealing. It's a blind alley with a big barred gate at the end!
Where's my dough?
Then you're not a policeman?
Only on my mother's side, honey. Where's my dough?
Chances like this are never offered twice. This is it!
This is the stuff from his pockets. I don't like friskin' stiffs!
I have to trust someone, Don. I'd rather it be you.
I came to tell you somethin', Tiger. If you get that dough and dust with it, it'll be very, very bad!
How much have you spent?
$790, less than one tenth of one percent of all our money.
You going to take me back to shore or do I swim?
You move and I'll shoot you and say you killed my husband.
If I help you it's the gas chamber.
Neither one of us will get the gas chamber. People saw me come onto this boat with my husband and they'll see me get off with him, you're going to put on his hat and coat.
Now... what's this about lakes?
Jane, Jane, what's happening to us? The money sits down there in an old leather bag, and yet it's tearing us apart. It's poison, Jane. It's changing you. It's changing both of us.
I wish it were that simple, Allan, but I haven't changed. It's the way I am. You've got to let me keep that money.
Don't, don't, Jane.

No, Allan, I won't let you just give it away. Chances like this are never offered twice. This is it. I've been waiting for it, dreaming of it all my life - even when I was a kid. And it wasn't because we were poor, not hungry poor at least. I suppose, in a way, it was far worse. We were white collar poor, middle-class poor. The kind of people who can't quite keep up with the Joneses and die a little every day because they can't.
